Subject: Different kinds of nodes and connections
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=54567749
X-Yahoo-Profile: kenstanley01

Mattias and I have been discussing some of his experiments, and some 
issues came up that might be interesting to the group.

For those interested in memory, we have been talking about 
having "delay connections," a unique connection that sends a signal 
from the previous timestep...or even a 2-delay connection thats 
sends the signal from 2 timesteps ago.  These are different kinds of 
connections from usual no-delay connection, and would be considered 
different than a no-delay connection even connecting the same 
nodes.  But Mattias was saying (and maybe he will add to this) that 
preliminary experiments with the ant domain seem to show a real 
benefit from time delays.  

Another possibility is to have different activation functions beyond 
sigmoid, like gaussian, multiplication, addition, etc...  It is 
possible this would expand the ability of NEAT to approximate 
complex functions.  At least in Mattias' symbolic regression, it's 
clear they help.  I'm not sure if they help in control tasks, but it 
could be interesting to play with.  I've been asked about this 
before, but Mattias' work is the first that actually shows how these 
can help.

Giving NEAT extra pieces to put together can be beneficial, or it 
can unnecesarily add to the search space, but at least in some cases 
it looks like a good idea and it's something to consider if you're 
playing with your own NEAT-based system.

ken
